intro: Astrocarpa sesamoides subsp. minor, commonly known as the small-seeded sesamoid daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow ray florets and dark brown disk florets. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it typically grows in dry, sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
